knowledge.getting_started.title: Getting started
knowledge.getting_started.subtitle: Legacy knowledge base
knowledge.getting_started.summary: A quick orientation for admins moving from the legacy backoffice into the new command center.
knowledge.getting_started.section.1.body: Confirm you have an internal role and the required permissions before using admin workflows.
knowledge.getting_started.section.2.body: Use the left navigation to move across IAM, support, payments, catalog, and configuration modules.
knowledge.getting_started.section.3.body: Feature flags and app settings propagate to client apps. Validate changes through Config Preview or Experience Studio.
knowledge.getting_started.section.4.body: Ops Center runs migrations, tests, and smoke checks; use it for controlled rollouts.
knowledge.security.title: Security guide
knowledge.security.subtitle: Legacy knowledge base
knowledge.security.summary: Core security practices for admin operators, aligned with RBAC and audit requirements.
knowledge.security.section.1.title: RBAC scope
knowledge.security.section.1.body: Use role templates and permissions to limit access. Avoid granting superuser unless required.
knowledge.security.section.2.title: Session management
knowledge.security.section.2.body: Monitor session devices and terminate suspicious sessions from IAM > Sessions.
knowledge.security.section.3.title: Audit visibility
knowledge.security.section.3.body: Every sensitive action should show in Audit Logs. Use filters to trace incidents quickly.
knowledge.security.section.4.title: Ops safeguards
knowledge.security.section.4.body: Run smoke checks before migrations and review health signals after deployments.
knowledge.payments.title: Payments guide
knowledge.payments.subtitle: Legacy knowledge base
knowledge.payments.summary: Operational playbook for orders, proofs, escrow flows, and reconciliation checks.
knowledge.payments.section.1.title: Orders overview
knowledge.payments.section.1.body: Track order volume, status, and anomalies before approving or escalating.
knowledge.payments.section.2.title: Proof review
knowledge.payments.section.2.body: Validate payment proofs promptly; record decisions and link to audit logs.
knowledge.payments.section.3.title: Escrow handling
knowledge.payments.section.3.body: Verify escrow releases align with SLA and dispute policies.
knowledge.payments.section.4.title: Reconciliation
knowledge.payments.section.4.body: Cross-check payouts and bank entries with audit logs and payment intents.
studio.help.brand_name: Primary brand label shown across the app.
studio.help.brand_logo: Public URL to the logo asset (SVG or PNG).
studio.help.support_email: Customer support contact displayed in the app.
studio.help.theme_color: Use HEX or CSS color values (e.g., #0F7A78).
studio.help.theme_font: Must match a font loaded by the front-end (e.g., Cairo).
studio.help.typography_scale: 1 = base size, 1.1 for larger copy, 0.9 for compact.
studio.help.guest_enabled: Allow guests to browse without authentication.
studio.help.pin_length: Number of digits required for PIN login.
studio.help.default_locale: Locale tag such as ar, en-US.
studio.help.default_currency: ISO currency code such as SAR or USD.
studio.help.card_radius: Corner radius for cards in pixels.

studio.notes.title: Design notes
studio.notes.ui: Keep UI toggles cohesive; document layout intentions and fallback styles.
studio.notes.rules: Define eligibility, routing, and exposure rules with clear owner intent.
studio.notes.locale: Validate locale-specific copy, RTL layouts, and fallback translations.
studio.notes.commerce: Align pricing, badges, and promotions with revenue goals.
studio.notes.announcements: Publish announcements with schedule and audience targeting.
studio.notes.snapshot: Keep snapshot values concise for leadership visibility.
